definition: wartime
to fight/fight/war/battle
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi

sentences.english: Captain Aoyagi, the company commander, was killed while he directed the defense.
sentences.chinese: 連隊指揮官，青柳上尉，在直接參加防禦戰時陣亡。

sentences.english: This therefore frees the pilot to concentrate on his intended tasks during the combat.
sentences.chinese: 這樣可以將飛行員在戰時解放出來更關注於他的任務。

sentences.english: Zhou Gucheng concerns himself with Chinas modernization from the period of the War of Resistence Against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 從抗戰時期起周谷城就關心國家的現代化問題。

sentences.english: The second chapter probes into the governmental educational salvage system.
sentences.chinese: 第二章探討國民政府的戰時教育救助體制。

sentences.english: The Beard family's war was probably not untypical.
sentences.chinese: 比爾德家庭戰時的經歷或許並不特殊。

sentences.english: All the people,men and women,old and young have plunged into war in the wartime.
sentences.chinese: 戰時所有男女老少都投入到戰爭中去。

sentences.english: The foreign ministry refers not to the women, but to “the issue known as ‘wartime comfort women’”.
sentences.chinese: 日本外交部從不提及個別女性，只稱“戰時慰安婦”。

sentences.english: I think more clearly when I'm challenged.
sentences.chinese: 當我受到挑戰時，我想得很仔細。

sentences.english: A veteran should be entitled to special treatment because of his service in war.
sentences.chinese: 老兵因在戰時服過役應享有特殊待遇。

sentences.english: And Coca-Cola managed to make itself one of the most widely distributed products of wartime.
sentences.chinese: 可口可樂更力爭上游，成爲戰時最暢銷產品之一。

sentences.english: This temple served for an operating room during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 在抗戰時期這座廟曾用來作手術室。

sentences.english: Street lighting was dimmed out during the war.
sentences.chinese: 戰時街道照明實行半燈火管制。

sentences.english: A warship involved in a battle would encounter the assault from enemy anti-warship weapons.
sentences.chinese: 艦船在海戰時，會遭到敵方反艦武器的攻擊。

sentences.english: The country's economics must be geared to war-time requirement.
sentences.chinese: 國家的經濟必須適合於戰時的需要。

sentences.english: Who communicates at table with others must be rushing into toilet at war-time.
sentences.chinese: 溝通時上餐桌的人，就是作戰時上廁所的人。

sentences.english: The water torture was a favorite among Japanese POW guards during WWII.
sentences.chinese: 水刑是二戰時期日本戰俘守衛最喜歡的一種刑罰。

definition: sb who tries to be on good terms with everyone
to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
wordless and silent (idiom); without speaking/taciturn
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
(coll.) to enjoy showing off
to bear grudges
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
poetic and passionate (idiom); romance/love affair
sometimes good, sometimes bad
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
